rooms.Name: Entrance to the museum
rooms.Description:
Your ticket is taken as you walk into the museum. It has several different
types of displays shown here. One wing begins with sculptures, another with
paintings, and the last with statues. Not just ordinary statues, but almost
a place of worship. These statues are dedicated to the Gods that rule this
World.

rooms.Name: Entrance to the museum
rooms.Description:
The main hall of the musuem is quite lofty. You find the painting
of the walls quite lovely. It actually looks like you are walking
in a field, with the sun shining down on you, the grass growing
all around you. Heat comes from the sun, making you wonder what
kind of magic is involved there. Off in the distance, you can
hear the curator bragging about his museum.

rooms.Name: Exhibit of Shifter
rooms.Description:
You are passing through the most interesting exhibit you've ever seen in any
exhibit. Every display, every painting is utterly fascinating. You stare in
wonder a few moments, taking it in. After quite a while you think you've 
seen everything you wanted to here...
...there's a strange tingling in the back of your head....
You turn and look back at the exhibit and notice that it has changed
completely! Anything you've ever wanted to see in a museum exhibit is
displayed before you. Once more you stare at the wonders before you...
and you forget all about that funny little tingling of magic in the back of
your head...

rooms.Name: Main Chamber
rooms.Description:
This room seperates the different wings of the musuem. Each wing
has a little sampling of each display. One wing has modern art,
while another will have very old sculptures included with it. As
the wing ends, there are statues of the Gods.

rooms.Name: Main Hall
rooms.Description:
This main hall looks even larger than the first. The ceiling 
shows the night sky, each star showing brilliantly. As you look,
you can see the moon move across the sky, the constellations
rotate in the blackness.

rooms.Name: East Wing
rooms.Description:
The east wing of the museum beings with paintings of wilderness
scenes. Some are peaceful, showing people on picnics, or children
running through the forest. Others however, take a darker image.
They show creatures fighting, trying to show dominance. Mothers
hurry their children past these.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This series of pictures shows a family going out for a picnic. The mother
making the table, the father playing with the children, other families
sitting down to enjoy their time together.

This picture shows a pack of wolves, slowly tracking their prey, a small dear.
It shows them about to move in for the kill.

rooms.Name: West Wing
rooms.Description:
The west wing begins with the picture of a warrior, suiting up
in his armor. His squire prepares his horse and goes over his
weapons, making sure everything is perfect. The knight mounts his
horse, and heads to battle.

rooms.Name: Center Room
rooms.Description:
This room is the splitting point of the furthest 3 wings. Each
wing from here tells a story, some with statues moving or sounds
helping describe the pictures. The head and cold of some of them
is apparent from here, making you wonder how strong the magic
is.

rooms.Name: Exhibit of Jahana
rooms.Description:
You enter this room and almost get scorched by a dragon! You pull out
your sword only to find there's no dragon here. Well, no real dragon
anyways. The fire came from a gigantic sculpture sitting in the middle
of the room. The walls are lined with every type of dragon you could
imagine there being. Red dragons, blue dragons, yellow dragons, even
dragons with riders on them. Some are flying, some are in battle, each
image captures the sheer beauty of the dragon.

rooms.Name: Exhibit of Jahana
rooms.Description:
This room is made to be an exact replica of Jahana's office. A large
desk sits in the middle of the room. A large golden scale sits on one
side of it, a gift from her associate BigH. The walls are filled with
different computer screens, each showing a different scene. As you look
around the room, you see on picture in particular that catches your eye...
it's you! It's showing you looking at yourself. So that's how she keeps
an eye on those mortals! She can watch them all at once to keep them
out of trouble. Knowing that she's watching you makes you feel safer as
you move to the next exhibit.

rooms.Name: Final Exhibit of Jahana
rooms.Description:
The final exhibit of Jahana combines the other two with a few added
extras. It's a scene of Jahana's spot of relaxation. A comfortable 
couch and chair look so inviting you almost sit there yourself. The room
has all the necessities of relaxation, a stereo, tv, and of course, a 
computer. A little warning light on the computer lets her know if anyone
is misbehaving. All over the room are pictures of Jahana and her husband, 
Daxx. Pictures of their wedding, trips, and even at home line the walls
and desks of this room. The place almost seems to lull you into sleep.

rooms.Name: Exhibit of Daxx
rooms.Description:
You walk into this room and almost turn into an icecube. It's freezing in 
here! Why on earth is the room so darn cold! You look around and figure out
why. It's filled with nothign but computer equipment. You find yourself 
actually standing next to a supercomputer. You can hear it whirring off
billions of calculations a second. So this is what Daxx uses to help him
run things around here.

rooms.Name: Exhibit of Daxx
rooms.Description:
Several terminals line the walls of this room. Each screen has a different
picture on it. Some have pictures of cities crowded with poeple, some have 
beautiful pictures of mountains and the wilderness. You see people watch
the screen, then push a button and disappear. You look at the terminals,
and there they are! Inside the terminal! You realize this is the most
advanced display of virtual reality you have ever seen. Now, you have to
make a choice. Do you live out your fantasies, or do you move on?

rooms.Name: Final Exhibit of Daxx
rooms.Description:
As you enter this room you stop and stare in awe. You can feel the power
radiate throughout the room. As you look around, you can see this is a place
of peace and worship. An altar rests in the far end of the room, overshadowed
by a large cross. Pictures of the worshipped gods reside on the walls, giving
each person a God to worship. The entire room is underlaid by an enormous
persian rug. Looking at the near part of the room, you see Daxx, paying close
attention to many floating crystal balls. You look into the crystal balls and
see the images of the other statues. Daxx has declared himself the
protectorate of the others, so has taken it upon himself to watch over them.
Watching each ball, he stands ready to defend them if necessary. If you dare
to harm those whom he watches over, prepare to face the wrath of Daxx.

rooms.Name: Exhibit of Shifter
rooms.Description:
Along both sides of this long hallway are statues depicting verious deities
from various corners of the multiverse, as well as other powerful
extraplanar minions. Every few seconds the statues change form to show
another god or creature. You could watch for hours before ever seeing one
of the statues repeated. The only one that remains constant is a sculpture
of Mystra, Goddess of Magic, the source if Shifter's magical power.

rooms.Name: Final Exhibit of Shifter
rooms.Description:
This room is a nearly exact replica of Shifter's home in the planes:
 The modern equivalent of the stereotypical wizard's tower, this place
looks like the best place for the magi-technically oriented. While one
wall is lined with ancient spellbooks, another contains rack upon rack of
CD-ROM's, containing Gigabytes of digitally stored spells. A really
powerful-looking enchanted laptop computer sits on a futuristic desk. The
enspelled ethernet link allows lag-free internet access 24/7. You could
spend weeks in here without ever getting bored.

rooms.Name: North East Wing
rooms.Description:
A wedding is spread all around you. The guests sit and talk, the
mother of the bride running here and there frantically. The groom
stands near the altar, waiting for the ceremony to begin. He keeps
looking up and ahead of him, hoping to catch a glimpse of his
future wife.

rooms.Name: North East Wing
rooms.Description:
The guests begin to sit as the music begins to play. The groom
looks around anxiously, wanting just a glimpse of his bride, but
he is denied. The door opens, and the bridesmaids being to walk
out, followed by the bride herself. She is dressed in a shining
white dress, flowing down to the ground.

rooms.Name: North East Wing
rooms.Description:
The wind picks up around the wedding. Everyone looks to the sky, 
and terror crosses their face: A dragon is swooping down towards
them! He sprays the crowd with fire, burning many people. He
dives straight towards the bride, scoops her in his claw, and
flies into the air, out of sight.

rooms.Name: North East Wing
rooms.Description:
The dragon has flown the lovely bride to his dwelling on the 
cliff of a large mountain. There is no direct way to climb up, the
only entrance seems to be from flight. As the dragon flies in, a
stone door clamps shut, leaving the screaming bride no where to
run.

rooms.Name: North East Wing
rooms.Description:
A strange darnkess fills the air above the mountain. It is as if
the very clouds have taken on a mind of their own. They begin to
darken and swirl. The dragon, on alert, opens his cave to witness
the phenomenon. An image forms on the clouds: the image of a mage.
It warns the dragon to let the lady go. The last part shows the
ensuing battle between the two.

rooms.Name: Northern Wing
rooms.Description:
A great battle is displayed here. It is the story of the Gods of
this world, and how it came to be. It begins with the Head of the
Gods, Daxx, and his battle. It shows him gain and lose ground, but
never quite get ahead. He then recruits several strong warriors
to help in his battle.

rooms.Name: Northern Wing
rooms.Description:
Daxx has begun battling back in this scene. He rules with his
Queen and the land prospers for a short while. But yet again Daxx
comes under attack. However, this time the enemy has grown in 
strength, and Daxx cannot fight it himself. You see him begin to
fall back and prepare for the final push.

rooms.Name: Northern Wing
rooms.Description:
A powerful wizard has joined Daxx, and together they were able
to hold off the enemy. But thier spirit and powers were draining,
so together they decided to create a new world. A world of peace
and prosperity. They toiled long and hard, but finally came up
with this new and wonderful world. Daxx and his Queen, along with
the wizard, their Dragon warrior, and their Creator, ruled this
new world as long as time shall last.

rooms.Name: Exhibit of Viper
rooms.Description:
You have entered into a room in such a hurry you worry about
getting run over. Helpers of the great God scurry here and there,
finding out information or doing the tasks they were set out to
do. A small screen is used to communicate with their boss, Viper.
He is able to manage them from one of his various quests he runs
for the mortals of this land. You hurry through the room for
fear of getting run over.

rooms.Name: Exhibit of Viper
rooms.Description:
This is the metal working factory Viper is constantly using to
make the prizes for his quests. The walls are lined with everything
from swords to suits of armor. They vary in size and shape, and
are separated by magnitude of magic. The most powerful ones are
guarded by soldiers, to make those weak willed workers think 
twice about trying to steal from the might Viper.

rooms.Name: Final Exhibit of Viper
rooms.Description:
This room shows the true Viper, as the other Gods see him. Each
wall shows a different side of him, yet they all combine to form
his power. Along one wall are the weapons he has used, both to
help those and need and dispatch those that opposed him. Along
another wall are links to the temples that worship the mighty God.
The last 2 walls are filled with various equipment and treasures
he has gathered throughout the years. In the center of the room
lies a large oak desk, with a computer terminal on it. From here
he runs his great empire.

rooms.Name: North West Wing
rooms.Description:
They have begun their journey. A knight, a wizard, and a holy man.
They are searching for the Horn of Athens. The treasure said to
have the power to make the user invulnerable to magic, or even
raise the dead. The excitement in their eyes washes away the 
fear in their hearts.

rooms.Name: North West Wing
rooms.Description:
The group encounters many small battles on their journey. Some of
the more dangerous ones are shown here: the nest of the griffons,
the home of the ogres, and the caves of the trolls. Although at
times they were beaten and hurt, they continue on, the only thing
they can concentrate on, the Horn.

rooms.Name: Exhibit of Sarnoth
rooms.Description:
Samples of physics from history to future fill this room. Such things as the
steam engine to time travel. Sarnoth's theories and experiences are on display
with each exhibit shown. With a push of a button, you can warp yourself back
in time or into the future. Evidence of this discoveries, black holes
and warping space, are shown in great detail. Even the great Sarnoth himself
can give you a lecture, simply by activating the hologram image located in the
back of the room.

rooms.Name: Exhibit of Sarnoth
rooms.Description:
The sheer force of magic in this room knocks you to the floor. You can almost
feel it, as if it were alive. The walls almost seem to breathe the with force
of such powerful magic. Weak minded magic users and clerics have gone mad upon
simply entering the room. Paladins drop to their knees and pray to their gods.
Antipaladins almost lose control of their powers and struggle to keep them
in check. You realize that if you don't leave this room soon, you may never
leave it at all.

rooms.Name: Final Exhibit of Sarnoth
rooms.Description:
Chaos rages all around you, but you can't quite tell what it is. A thick mist
surrounds you, and everything seems invisible and opaque except for one small
path leading through the mist. You can hear creatures hissing and snarling at
you, but they don't dare tread near the path. As you come to the end of the
path, the mist starts to clear. Sitting alone in a calm magical circle is the
statue of Sarnoth. The choas cannot penetrate the circle that protects the
statue. You step into the circle and feel glad you made it.

rooms.Name: North West Wing
rooms.Description:
The adventuerers have finally found their goal: the castle of
The Dark One. No human has ever seen him and lived to tell the
tale, but the rumors are vicious. He is said to have glowing
eyes, the strength of a dragon, and the speed unmatched in this
world. After the holy man has prepared them, the group enters, 
not sure if they will return or not.

rooms.Name: North West Wing
rooms.Description:
The knight leads the young group through the castle. His eyes and
his cunning knowledge has already saved them from many of the
traps set by the Dark One. The traps he missed, however, hurt
him deeply. The holy man healed all he could of the knight, and
the power of the wizard keeps him going.

rooms.Name: North West Wing
rooms.Description:
A terrible battle ensues upon entering the Dark One's chamber.
The knight is repeatedly thrown to the floor, or slammed into a
wall. Even the wizard struggles with the power of the Dark One.
At points he cowers on the ground, unable to handle the mental
strain. The holy man prays to his god, asking for divine help.
In the end, the Dark One fell, as did his killer, the brave
knight. The holy man, with the Horn, is able to revive the knight,
and the three return to end their quest.

rooms.Name: East Wing
rooms.Description:
The wilderness scenes continue into this room. It shows a typical
fairy tale view of the forest: birds singing, animals playing, 
and adventurers traveling through. You can hear the sounds of
nature as you walk through and find it very peaceful.

rooms.Name: East Wing
rooms.Description:
The scenery takes a turn here. You see a river flowing along the
ground, and sculptures have popped up here and there. Some are 
of great warriors and kings, others of noble adventurers that
discovered this great land.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The statue of a great adventurer stands here, scanning the room as if
to look out for the dangers of the forest.

rooms.Name: East Wing
rooms.Description:
A boat seemingly floats along the river here, carrying fortune
seakers towards new treasures and fame. The captain screams at 
his crew as they scramble to keep the boat going. Lookouts watch
the sky for the likes of dragons or rocs.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The boat has a mean looking captain. He has one arm missing, which has
been replaced with a sword. You can see the dried blood on it, probably from the
last crewman that disobeyed him.

rooms.Name: East Wing
rooms.Description:
This room marks the end of the scenery. It shows the captain and
his crew departing the boat and heading towards a town. The crew
looks ready for their leave. The passengers head towards the 
center of town, hoping to find an inland ride to fortune.

rooms.Name: West Wing
rooms.Description:
The knight has entered the heat of battle. His sword flashes in
the bright sun. Many men fall at his feet. He has suffered cuts
and bruises, but he still continues, loyal to the end. As the
enemy retreats, he follows after, chasing the commander of the
army.

rooms.Name: West Wing
rooms.Description:
The knight and his company have caught up to the fleeing army and
begin to cut them down. The commander stops fleeing and signals
to people behind a hill. From the blue, arrows begin to shower
the valiant knight and his company. They scream as the arrows
pierce their heart.

rooms.Name: West Wing
rooms.Description:
The company of the knight has been badly beaten down, having
their number cut to pieces. The valiant knight has continued
fighting, an arrow sticking out from his chest, near his heart.
He refuses to give up, fighting till every last piece of energy
is expended.

rooms.Name: West Wing
rooms.Description:
Our valiant knight has begun to fall. They enemy has incircled
him. He slashes in every direction, trying to take out as many
as he can. His energy fails, and he falls to the ground, near
death. The scenery ends with the sound of stampeding horses 
coming towards the knight.

rooms.Name: Storehouse
rooms.Description:
This basement is used as the storehouse for the museum.
All the works of art not being displaye are put here
for future use. Some of the newer art works are kept under
secrecy down here.

rooms.Name: The dark and dreary Shadows
rooms.Description:
The room you have entered has a feel of death to it.  Your light source 
seems almost unable to penetrate the darkness here.  You can feel the 
presence ot the rooms keeper although he is not immeadiatly visible to you.
Retreat is a wise move and would not be considered cowerdice.  Remember....
to flee and live means you can fight another day.  You have been warned.

rooms.Name: A dilapidated cardboard box
rooms.Description:
This cardboard box is The Maxx's only home in this plane, apart
from occasional nights on Julie's sofa - or in the local Jail.
The sound of rain pelting the box is soothing, but there is a
definite melancholy air enveloping this place of brooding.

rooms.Name: A dark cave.
rooms.Description:
You enter a large cave that is dark and damp.  You here the low growling 
of some beast near the back of the cave.  As you continue on the only 
thing that you see is a large statue with a snarl for a smile.  The 
cave walls have trails of water running down, forming small pools at the 
base of the walls. All around you are the bones of adventurers who lost 
their life, fighting the bear.

rooms.Name: The Vampiric Lairs
rooms.Description:
A huge, twin sized coffin resides in one corner.  Shadows dance around the
room as huge candles cast an eerie light in the room.  This whole place
seems to have just come out of the past.  An old piano fills one corner,
while paintings depicting the horrors of the night line the wall.
You notice horrible claw marks in the walls and faded blood stains on
the floor.  You have entered the pit of evil and now must prepare yourself
to battle the masters of darkness.

rooms.Name: Nigel's Temple of Worship
rooms.Description:
===========================================================================
What a magnificent room you've just entered!  The walls are covered with
colorful mosaic tiles and the stained glass windows are just stunning.  You're
inside one of the world's most beautiful monuments, a temple which sole
purpose is to honor one of the most powerful Gods...Nigel!  The statue
of this almighty titan stands in front of the altar in a majestic pose.
The towering monolith looks quite intimidating but in fact...it's harmless
to those who worships and truly believe in the Great One.  Nigel, himself,
has sculptured this statue into his image and he gave a part of his soul
to animate it.  The Statue of Nigel was left here to guard this great
temple so that the memories of the Great One will never be forgotten.
===========================================================================

rooms.Name: BigH's Lair
rooms.Description:
You enter this little room to discover its owner standing in the shadows,
murmuring about 'wussboy' and telling you he will be the judge of that.
It is the lair of the fabled God of Justice, how he got the title it has
been to long for him to remember, but he still upholds the law of the mud.
He is not, however, above playing with the morts' thoughts and desires.
You sense a slight mean streak that appears every once in a while.  He
gazes at you for the first time, 6'8" with eyes that stare right through
you, maybe you should go before he takes his aggressions out on you!

rooms.Name: White
rooms.Description:
The room you have entered seems to stretch off into infinity in all
directions save the way you entered.  It seems void of color, just a blinding
white which appears to radiate over the entire area.  All sound seems to be
absorbed by the vast openess and the silence is almost disorienting.

rooms.Name: Jahana's Room
rooms.Description:
As you enter this pleasing to the eye room, you see the statue of the one
and only Jahana, no one else could have those glowing inviting eyes. They
call to you and beckon you closer, you realize you could tell no lie. There
is a desk with her paperwork and a small golden scale, a gift from BigH on
her being his assistant and for her endless and ever appreciated help. The
room is light and airy and calls you to kick back and relax!

rooms.Name: Sheol's dirty apartment
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a cluttered one room apartment.  You see a futon that
he has been using for years, his wife is nowhere to be found, you might
want to check south of midgaard.

rooms.Name: Daxx's Sanctum
rooms.Description:
As you enter this room you stop and stare in awe. You can feel the power
radiate throughout the room. As you look around, you can see this is a place
of peace and worship. An altar rests in the far end of the room, overshadowed
by a large cross. Pictures of the worshipped gods reside on the walls, giving
each person a God to worship. The entire room is underlaid by an enormous
persian rug. Looking at the near part of the room, you see Daxx, paying close
attention to many floating crystal balls. You look into the crystal balls and
see the images of the other statues. Daxx has declared himself the
protectorate of the others, so has taken it upon himself to watch over them.
Watching each ball, he stands ready to defend them if necessary. If you dare
to harm those whom he watches over, prepare to face the wrath of Daxx.

rooms.Name: Azurel's Haven
rooms.Description:
Tis a peaceful place, this one...  located on a cloud, you can see for miles 
in every direction. There are spectacular views of the ocean, the mountain 
ranges and the forests and fields. Several comfortable looking tuffets of 
cloud are here and there. Further away from the edge of the cloud, there is a 
grassy area and a lovely clear pond. A small waterfall trickles down into the 
pond from an unseen starting point. A graceful tree stands beside the pond.

Exits.Description:
A Hallway that leads to the memorials of adventures who have past on to 
an immortal state to adventure no longer......

rooms.Name: Center Ice in Harkin's House O Pain
rooms.Description:
You have entered the skating rink of hell. The protective glass has all been
shattered to pieces. Bits and pieces of hockey gear lie everywhere. Some even
have the hockey players that went in them still. Looking at the rink you gasp
as you notice the lines aren't made of paint, but of blood! It must have taken
a LOT of bodies to create that much. As you become aware of this, you hear a
slow gutteral laugh coming from behind you. You whirl to face the noise, and
already you regret walking into this room. Before you stands Harkin, a literal
giant in a hockey uniform. He drinks his snapple and eats the bottle. He grins
at you and says, "You're next!".
